line_1: 'Tis better sure than when, in tilted cart
line_2: Each tragic hero mouth'd his thund'ring part.

line_1: His groans now told the motions of the cart;
line_2: His feeble voice now spoke a sinking heart;

line_1: Now fitted the Halter, now travers'd the Cart;
line_2: And often took Leave; but was loath to Depart.

line_1: For lo, the murd'ring BUTCHER with his cart
line_2: Care loads his brow, and pity wrings his heart,
